meanings.definition: A person who redeems or saves another from difficulty or harm.
meanings.sent1: The kind goel helped the lost child find their way home.
meanings.sent2: The goel rescued the injured bird and nursed it back to health.
meanings.sent3: The goel with a cape swooped in to save the day.
meanings.sent4: She was like a guardian goel, always there to protect her friends.
meanings.sent5: The goel's presence was a beacon of hope in the dark forest.

meanings.definition: To act as a redeemer or savior for someone.
meanings.sent1: I will goel you from the bullies if they bother you again.
meanings.sent2: He decided to goel his friend by lending him money for the bus fare.
meanings.sent3: She goeled her brother by standing up to the school bully for him.
meanings.sent4: The firefighter goeled the kitten from the burning building.
meanings.sent5: The superhero's mission was to goel the city from evil villains.

meanings.definition: The act of redeeming or saving someone from difficulty or harm.
meanings.sent1: The goel of the story was the brave knight who rescued the princess.
meanings.sent2: Her goel of helping the homeless inspired others to do the same.
meanings.sent3: The goel of the play was to show the power of forgiveness.
meanings.sent4: The goel of the charity event was to raise funds for the orphanage.
meanings.sent5: His goel in life was to make a positive impact on those around him.
